Constructor. 0xRRGGBB. The default value is 0xFF0000. .25 sets a transparency value of 25%. that are a power of 2 (such as 2, 4, 8, 16 and 32) are optimized to render more quickly than other values. Values that are a power of 2 (such as 2, 4, 8, 16 and 32) are optimized to render more quickly than other values. the more color is imprinted and the stronger the contrast between the glow and the background. Valid values are 0 to 255.
  • BitmapFilterQuality.LOW
  • BitmapFilterQuality.MEDIUM
  • BitmapFilterQuality.HIGH

For more information, see the description of the quality property.

an inner glow. The value false specifies an outer glow (a glow around the outer edges of the object). makes the object's fill transparent and reveals the background color of the document.

values: color The color of the glow, in the hexadecimal format
alpha The alpha transparency value for the color. Valid values are 0 to 1. For example,
blurX The amount of horizontal blur. Valid values are 0 to 255 (floating point). Values
blurY The amount of vertical blur. Valid values are 0 to 255 (floating point).
strength The strength of the imprint or spread. The higher the value,
quality The number of times to apply the filter. Use the BitmapFilterQuality constants:
inner Specifies whether the glow is an inner glow. The value true specifies
knockout Specifies whether the object has a knockout effect. The value true

members.description: The alpha transparency value for the color. Valid values are 0 to 1. For example, .25 sets a transparency value of 25%.
The color of the glow. Valid values are in the hexadecimal format 0xRRGGBB.
Specifies whether the glow is an inner glow. The value true indicates an inner glow. The default is false, meaning an outer glow (a glow around the outer edges of the object).
Returns a copy of this filter object. properties of the original GlowFilter instance.
